item.text: He made a bronze altar, 30 feet long, 30 feet wide, and 15 feet high.

He also <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> the big <st data-num="03332" class="">bronze</st> basin called “The <st data-num="03220" class="">Sea</st>.”<n id="1" /> It measured <st data-num="06235 0520">15 feet</st><n id="2" /> from <st data-num="08193" class="">rim</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="08193" class="">rim</st>, was <st data-num="05696" class="">circular</st> in <st data-num="05439" class="">shape</st>, and stood <st data-num="02568 0520">7½</st> feet<n id="3" /> <st data-num="06967" class="">high</st>. Its <st data-num="06957 05437 05439">circumference</st> was <st data-num="07970 0520">45 feet</st>.<n id="4" />

<st data-num="01823" class="">Images</st> of <st data-num="01241" class="">bulls</st> were <st data-num="08478" class="">under</st> it <st data-num="05439" class="">all</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">the way</st> <st data-num="05437" class="">around</st>, <st data-num="06235" class="">ten</st> every <st data-num="0520" class="">18 inches</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05362 03220">all the way</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">around</st>. The <st data-num="01241" class="">bulls</st> were in <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="02905" class="">rows</st> and had been <st data-num="03332" class="">cast</st> with “The <st data-num="04166" class="">Sea</st>.”<n id="2" />

“The Sea” <st data-num="05975" class="">stood</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on top of</st> <st data-num="08147 06240">twelve</st> <st data-num="01241" class="">bulls</st>. <st data-num="07969" class="">Three</st> <st data-num="06437" class="">faced</st> <st data-num="06828" class="">northward</st>, <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="06437 03220">westward</st>, <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="06437 05045">southward</st>, and <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="06437 04217">eastward</st>. “The <st data-num="03220" class="">Sea</st>” was placed <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> <st data-num="04605" class="">top</st> of them, and they <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="0268 01004">faced outward</st>.<n id="1" />

It was <st data-num="02947" class="">four fingers</st> <st data-num="05672" class="">thick</st>, and its <st data-num="08193" class="">rim</st> was <st data-num="04639" class="">like</st> <st data-num="08193" class="">that</st> of a <st data-num="03563" class="">cup</st> shaped like a <st data-num="07799" class="">lily</st> <st data-num="06525" class="">blossom</st>. It could <st data-num="02388 03557">hold</st> <st data-num="07969 0505 01324">18,000 gallons</st>.<n id="1" />
He made ten washing basins; he put five on the south side and five on the north side. In them they rinsed the items used for burnt sacrifices; the priests washed in “The Sea.”
He made ten gold lampstands according to specifications and put them in the temple, five on the right and five on the left.

He <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="06235" class="">ten</st> <st data-num="07979" class="">tables</st> and <st data-num="03240" class="">set</st> them in the <st data-num="01964" class="">temple</st>, <st data-num="02568" class="">five</st> on the <st data-num="03225" class="">right</st> and <st data-num="02568" class="">five</st> on the <st data-num="08040" class="">left</st>. He also <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="03967" class="">100</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="04219" class="">bowls</st>.

He <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> the <st data-num="02691" class="">courtyard</st> of the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st> and the <st data-num="01419" class="">large</st> <st data-num="05835" class="">enclosure</st> and <st data-num="05835" class="">its</st> <st data-num="01817" class="">doors</st>;<n id="1" /> he <st data-num="06823" class="">plated</st> their <st data-num="01817" class="">doors</st> with <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st>.
He put “The Sea” on the south side, in the southeast corner.
Huram Abi made the pots, shovels, and bowls. He finished all the work on God’s temple he had been assigned by King Solomon.

He made<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="05982" class="">pillars</st>, the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="01543" class="">bowl-shaped</st> <st data-num="03805 05921 07218">tops</st> of the <st data-num="05982 08147">pillars</st>, the <st data-num="07639 08147">latticework</st> <st data-num="03680" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="08147 01543">bowl-shaped</st> <st data-num="03805 0834 05921 07218">tops</st> of the two <st data-num="05982" class="">pillars</st>,

the <st data-num="0702 03967" class="">400</st> <st data-num="07416" class="">pomegranate-shaped ornaments</st> for the <st data-num="07639" class="">latticework</st> of the <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> pillars (<st data-num="0259" class="">each</st> <st data-num="07639" class="">latticework</st> had <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="02905" class="">rows</st> of these <st data-num="07416" class="">ornaments</st> <st data-num="03680" class="">at</st> the <st data-num="08147 01543">bowl-shaped</st> <st data-num="03805" class="">top</st> <st data-num="0834 05921 06440">of</st> the <st data-num="05982" class="">pillar</st>),

the <st data-num="06235" class="">ten</st><n id="1" /> movable <st data-num="04350" class="">stands</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">with</st> <st data-num="04350" class="">their</st> <st data-num="06235" class="">ten</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="03595" class="">basins</st>,

the <st data-num="0259" class="">big bronze basin</st> called “The <st data-num="03220" class="">Sea</st>” with its <st data-num="08147 06240">twelve</st> <st data-num="01241" class="">bulls</st> <st data-num="08478" class="">underneath</st>,
and the pots, shovels, and meat forks. All the items King Solomon assigned Huram Abi to make for the Lord’s temple were made from polished bronze.

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> had them <st data-num="03332" class="">cast</st> in <st data-num="0127" class="">earth</st> <st data-num="05645" class="">foundries</st><n id="1" /> in the <st data-num="03603" class="">region</st> of the <st data-num="03383" class="">Jordan</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> <st data-num="05523" class="">Sukkoth</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">and</st> <st data-num="06868" class="">Zarethan</st>.
Solomon made so many of these items they did not weigh the bronze.
Solomon also made these items for God’s temple: the gold altar, the tables on which the Bread of the Presence was kept,

the <st data-num="05462" class="">pure</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="04501" class="">lampstands</st> and their <st data-num="05216" class="">lamps</st> which <st data-num="01197" class="">burned</st> as <st data-num="04941" class="">specified</st> at the <st data-num="06440" class="">entrance</st> to the <st data-num="01687" class="">inner sanctuary</st>,

the <st data-num="01931 04357 02091">pure</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="06525" class="">flower-shaped ornaments</st>, <st data-num="05216" class="">lamps</st>, and <st data-num="04457" class="">tongs</st>,

the <st data-num="05462" class="">pure</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="04212" class="">trimming shears</st>, <st data-num="04219" class="">basins</st>, <st data-num="03709" class="">pans</st>, and <st data-num="04289" class="">censers</st>, and the <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="01817" class="">door</st> <st data-num="06607 01004">sockets</st> for the <st data-num="06442" class="">inner sanctuary</st> (the <st data-num="06944" class="">Most</st> <st data-num="06944" class="">Holy Place</st>) and for the <st data-num="01817" class="">doors</st> of the <st data-num="01964" class="">main hall</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>.
